body_content.explanation: a member of a race of people who were the first people to live on the islands now known as the Torres Strait Islands, between the North of Australia and Papua New Guinea, before any Europeans arrived:
examples: Torres Strait Islanders were not traditionally hunters and gatherers. They cultivated vegetable gardens and lived in huts in settled villages.
We work with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people all around Australia from remote communities to rural centres.
